personalInfo.name: Quique Ruiz Navarro
personalInfo.introduction: I am a passionate DevOps/SRE with extensive experience in creating, maintaining, and monitoring cloud (AWS, Azure) and on-premise infrastructures. I am driven by automation and continuous improvement, with a strong focus on high availability, security, and scalability. I am currently pursuing a PhD in Computer Engineering, focusing on Machine Learning for data streams.
skills: AWS: EKS, EC2, VPC, RDS, ECS, S3, ECR, DocDB, SQS, SNS, Lambdas, VPN, PrivateLinks, CloudFormation, Route53
Azure: AKS, VMs, VNET, PrivateLinks, Blob Storage, VPN
GCP: GKE,  Cloud Storage, VPC, VPN
CI/CD: ArgoCD, GitHub Actions, Azure DevOps

projects.title: Trivy API
projects.description: A RESTful API built with Go for scanning Docker images to identify potential vulnerabilities and ensure secure deployments.

projects.title: MockStreamData
projects.description: MockStreamData is a Python tool designed to stress-test online machine learning models by continuously streaming data. It simulates real-time data flows by generating batches from popular datasets (such as any of River's dataset) so you can evaluate your models' performance and capacity under load.

projects.title: Trivy to Google Sheets
projects.description: trivy-to-google-sheets is a Python package that automates running Trivy scans on container images and exporting the results to a Google Sheet. It also automatically shares the generated sheet with specified emails and can be used as a command-line tool.

blogPosts.title: Kafka on Kubernetes with Strimzi
blogPosts.excerpt: This tutorial demonstrates how Strimzi simplifies the deployment and administration of Apache Kafka on Kubernetes, covering everything from setup to monitoring and security. Learn step by step to fully harness Kafkaâ€™s capabilities in dynamic environments.

experience.title: Senior SRE (Full Remote)
achievements: Designed CI/CD pipelines with Azure DevOps and GitHub Actions for monitoring and building applications
Created and maintained pipelines in Azure DevOps, managing AKS, EKS and GKE clusters
Implemented Helm charts for the deployment of applications on Kubernetes
Deployed infrastructures in AWS and Azure following best practices (AWS Well-Architected Framework)
Provided support and review of information system security policies to comply with ISO 27001
Developed an application packaging product using Ansible and Helm
Implemented ArgoCD to scale deployments to multiple clusters in less time
Developed and maintained scripts in Python, Bash, and Golang
Implemented security scanners in pipelines for early vulnerability detection

experience.title: DevOps/SRE
achievements: Designed CI/CD processes with Jenkins and Bitbucket pipelines for building and monitoring applications
Created secure containers following best practices for production environments
Managed large-scale AWS deployments using EKS, EC2, VPC, RDS, ECS, S3, ECR, DocDB, SQS, SNS, and Lambdas
Performed load tests to ensure high availability
Built infrastructure as code using Terraform with S3 as the backend for state management
Implemented Kubernetes in AWS using both EKS and EC2 instances, managing around 20 microservices in production
Developed and maintained scripts in Python, Bash, Node.js, and Golang
Automated large database operations using Ansible
Actively participated in Agile methodologies

experience.title: Assistant technician
achievements: Developed a tool to measure the elasticity of an application in certain environments.
Design a rating quota of APIs according to an SLA.
Study of performance of different database, such as Mongo and Elasticsearch.

experience.title: SysAdmin

Administration and configuration of Load balancers in HAproxy or Nginx.
Responsible for clusters such as Mysql.

Automate task with scripts with Bash or Python.
